Source code for test.Unit_Allgemein

"""
Created on 27.12.2013

@author: uhs374h

import unittest
from bruch import *



[docs]class TestAllgemein(unittest.TestCase):


[docs]    def setUp(self):
        self.b = Bruch(3, 2)
        self.b2 = Bruch(self.b)
        self.b3 = Bruch(4, 2)
        pass



[docs]    def tearDown(self):
        del self.b, self.b2, self.b3
        pass



[docs]    def testFloat(self):
        b = Bruch(3, 4)
        assert(float(b) == 0.75)



[docs]    def testInt(self):
        b = Bruch(5, 4)
        assert(int(b) == 1)



[docs]    def testComplex(self):
        b = Bruch(3, 4)
        assert(complex(b) == 0.75)



[docs]    def testInvert(self):
        z, n = 5, 4
        b = Bruch(z, n)
        assert(~b == Bruch(n, z))



[docs]    def testcreateBruchZeroError(self):
        self.assertRaises(ZeroDivisionError, Bruch, 3, 0)



[docs]    def testcreateBruchWrongTypeNenner(self):
        self.assertRaises(TypeError, Bruch, 3, 1.1)



[docs]    def testcreateBruchWrongTypeZaehler(self):
        self.assertRaises(TypeError, Bruch, 2.0)



[docs]    def testInteger(self):
        self.b2 = Bruch(3, 1)
        assert(str(self.b2) == '(3)')



[docs]    def testPow(self):
        h = 4
        assert(self.b2 ** h == Bruch(self.b2.zaehler ** h, self.b2.nenner ** h))



[docs]    def testPowError1(self):
        self.assertRaises(TypeError, self.b2.__pow__, 2.0)



[docs]    def testPowError2(self):
        self.assertRaises(TypeError, self.b2.__pow__, "other")



[docs]    def test_makeBruchTypeError(self):
        self.assertRaises(TypeError, Bruch._Bruch__makeBruch, "other")



[docs]    def test_makeBruchInt(self):
        value = 3
        b4 = Bruch._Bruch__makeBruch(value)
        assert(b4.zaehler == value)



[docs]    def testAbs(self):
        b4 = Bruch(-3, 2)
        assert(abs(b4) == Bruch(3, 2))



[docs]    def testNeg(self):
        b4 = Bruch(-3, 2)
        assert(-b4 == Bruch(3, 2))

    # test of references


[docs]    def testRef(self):
        assert(self.b is not self.b2)



[docs]    def testRef2(self):
        b4 = self.b
        assert(self.b is b4)



if __name__ == "__main__":
    unittest.main()
